title: Does South Belgium speak a 'Walloon language' or French? - Quora

response.answer_text: There exists a Walloon language (or even languages), but in the 19th and 20th century, there has been a large and concerted effort to introduce standard French. Wallonia is nowadays essentially French-speaking. Some efforts are made to conserve the Walloon language and to speak it, but those are minimal and mostly ineffective.

The south of Belgium speaks pretty much the French that is spoken in France but there are a few differences. Sometimes there is a little difference in accent and also the numbers 70 and 90 are in standard French : 70 = soixante-dix 90 = quatre-vingt-dix In the French speaking part of Belgium, they say 70 = septante 90 = nonante But that does not make a huge difference.
